Predicate.definition: to set or ground on something
Predicate.origin: [if Mary's claim is predicated simply on John's duty of support "W. M. McGovern, Jr. et al. "]

-cat·ing.definition: to set or ground on somethingfind a basis for usually used with[if Mary's claim issimply on John's duty of support "W. M. McGovern, Jr."][pre-di-kət] adjrelating to or being any of a series of criminal acts upon which prosecution for racketeering may be predicated [a act] [a crime]
